meanings.definition: To convert (data) from one form of coded representation to another.
meanings.sent1: I transcoded the information to make it easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: She always transcodes the files before sharing them with others.
meanings.sent3: The computer tried to transcode the message but ended up with gibberish.
meanings.sent4: His ability to transcoded complex ideas into simple terms is impressive.
meanings.sent5: The artist transcoded his emotions into a beautiful painting.

meanings.definition: To convert (a video or audio file) into a different format.
meanings.sent1: They transcoded the video to play it on different devices.
meanings.sent2: The software can easily transcode audio files into various formats.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally transcoded the song into a chipmunk version.
meanings.sent4: Her voice transcoded the lyrics into pure emotion.
meanings.sent5: The engineer transcoded the data to optimize streaming quality.
